criteria.label: Service Design & Boundaries
criteria.description: Clarity of separation between main, conductor, and domain components.

levels.label: Weak
levels.description: All logic lives in main or a god class; no clear boundaries.

levels.label: Okay
levels.description: Some separation exists, but cross-coupling and static access patterns remain.

levels.label: Strong
levels.description: Main wires dependencies then delegates to a focused OpsConductor; domain/infra concerns are separated.

criteria.label: Configuration Integration
criteria.description: Use of ReactorConfig and environment overrides.

levels.label: Loose
levels.description: Magic numbers and environment logic scattered across code.

levels.label: Mixed
levels.description: Some config wiring, but environment handling is ad-hoc or inconsistent.

levels.label: Cohesive
levels.description: ReactorConfig is a clear single source of truth; overrides are localized and passed into components cleanly.

criteria.label: Logging & Signals
criteria.description: Startup, loop events, errors, and shutdown visibility via logs.

levels.label: Noisy or Silent
levels.description: Either almost no logs or spammy logs with unclear meaning.

levels.label: Acceptable
levels.description: Basic logs exist, but levels/structure are inconsistent.

levels.label: Operational
levels.description: Logs clearly describe startup, environment, tick results, alarms, and shutdown at sensible levels.

criteria.label: Lifecycle & Tests
criteria.description: Graceful shutdown and testability of the run loop.

levels.label: Fragile
levels.description: Hard to stop; no tests around lifecycle or error paths.

levels.label: Basic
levels.description: Some lifecycle handling; tests cover only happy path.

levels.label: Resilient
levels.description: Clear start/stop semantics; tests exercise loop + shutdown behavior; main exits appropriately on failure.

instructions_to_model: You are evaluating a Java service boss called 'Reactor Ops Conductor'.
Use the criteria to assign 0, 1, or 2 for each.
Assess service design, configuration integration, logging, and lifecycle/testability.
Then compute score_total, score_max, passed (score_total >= pass_threshold), integrity (score_total / score_max), and a human-readable verdict.
zero_guidance.success_summary_hint: Describe why the service would be pleasant to run and debug in real environments.
zero_guidance.failure_summary_hint: Explain specific design and ops issues that would make the service difficult to rely on.
